level.heading: Filing and status of foreign judgments.
level.text: A copy of any foreign judgment authenticated in accordance with the laws of the District may be filed in the Office of the Clerk of the Superior Court ("Clerk"). A foreign judgment filed with the Clerk shall have the same effect and be subject to the same procedures, defenses, or proceedings for reopening, vacating, or staying as a judgment of the Superior Court and may be enforced or satisfied in the same manner.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-173
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-173, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 15-351.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 2 of the Uniform Enforcement of Foreign Judgments Act (1964).
